PHRASE.LANG: kName
Fresh Edomae Sushi
Sushi frais, à la mode d’Edo
Frischer Sushi nach Edo-Art
Sushi fresco in stile Edo
Sushi al estilo de Edo fresco
新鮮な江戸前寿司
신선한 에도마에 스시
Fresh Edomae Sushi
新鮮的江戶壽司
新鮮的江戶壽司
Fresh Edomae Sushi
kDesc
A type of local specialty mainly about hand-rolled sushi. In the Edo period it was not limited to sushi restaurants, but also commonly available in roadside stalls. [#Legal]
Sushi roulés à la main, typiques de la cuisine d’Edo. On ne les vendait pas que dans les restaurants mais aussi sur des étals à l’extérieur. [#Legal]
Handgerollter Sushi repräsentiert die Edo-Küche. Sushi wurde in der Edo-Zeit nicht nur in Restaurants verkauft, sondern auch an Ständen. [#Legal]
Il sushi preparato a mano era il piatto principale del periodo Edo. Il sushi veniva venduto non solo nei ristoranti, ma anche presso i chioschi del periodo Edo. [#Legal]
Sushi enrollado es el centro de la cocina de Edo. El sushi no solo era vendido en restaurantes, sino que también en puestos durante el período Edo. [#Legal]
握り寿司を中心とした江戸の郷土料理。江戸時代では寿司屋だけでなく屋台で売られることも多かった。 [#Legal]
니기리 스시를 중심으로 한 에도의 향토 요리. 에도시대에는 스시집 뿐만이 아니라 이동 수레에서 파는 일도 많았다. [#Legal]
A type of local specialty mainly about hand-rolled sushi. In the Edo period it was not limited to sushi restaurants, but also commonly available in roadside stalls. [#Legal]
以手握壽司為主的江戶鄉土料理。在江戶時代，不僅在壽司店，平常也能在路邊攤吃到。[#Legal]
以手握壽司為主的江戶鄉土料理。在江戶時代，不僅在壽司店，平常也能在路邊攤吃到。[#Legal]
A type of local specialty mainly about hand-rolled sushi. In the Edo period it was not limited to sushi restaurants, but also commonly available in roadside stalls. [#Legal]
